Detailed Description

Scrambled Halton quasi-random sequence generator.

Author:
Christian Gagne <cgagne@gmail.com>
Olivier Teytaud <olivier.teytaud@lri.fr>
Marc Parizeau <marc.parizeau@gel.ulaval.ca>

Generate low-discrepancy sequences of numbers (quasirandom numbers) using the scrambled Halton algorithm.

Definition at line 59 of file QRandSequencer.hpp.

void QRandSequencer::generateSequence ( std::vector< unsigned long > &  outValues,

) [protected]

outValues Generated values of the sequence

Definition at line 83 of file QRandSequencer.cpp.

00084 {
00085     outValues.resize(mBases.size());
00086     outMaxValues.resize(mBases.size());
00087     bool lShouldReset=false;
00088     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < mBases.size(); ++i) {
00089 
00090         // Increment the counter values according to their basis.
00091         unsigned int lIndex = 0;
00092         while((lIndex<mCounters[i].size()) && (mCounters[i][lIndex]==(mBases[i]-1))) {
00093             mCounters[i][lIndex] = 0;
00094             ++lIndex;
00095         }
00096         if(lIndex==mCounters[i].size()) mCounters[i].push_back(1);
00097         else ++mCounters[i][lIndex];
00098         
00099         // Unscramble the counter value and convert it from its prime basis.
00100         const unsigned int lCountSizeI = mCounters[i].size();
00101         unsigned long lBasesPow = mBases[i];
00102         outValues[i] = mPermutations[i][mCounters[i][lCountSizeI-1]];
00103         for(unsigned int j = lCountSizeI-1; j >= 1; --j) {
00104             outValues[i] += (mPermutations[i][mCounters[i][j-1]] * lBasesPow);
00105             lBasesPow *= mBases[i];
00106         }
00107         outMaxValues[i] = lBasesPow;
00108         
00109         // Check if we should reset counters.
00110         if(lBasesPow >= (LONG_MAX/mBases[i])) lShouldReset = true;
00111     }
00112     
00113     // Reset counters when we are getting near LONG_MAX on one component.
00114     if(lShouldReset) {
00115         for(unsigned int i = 0; i < mCounters.size(); ++i) mCounters.clear();
00116         mCount = 0;
00117     }
00118     else ++mCount;
00119 }

void QRandSequencer::getGaussianVector ( PACC::Vector &  outVector,
const PACC::Vector &  inCenter,
const PACC::Matrix &  inSqRootCovar 
)

Generate a point vector of gaussian distribution N(inCenter,inCovar).

Parameters:
outVector Generated vector point.
inCenter Center of the gaussian distribution.
inSqRootCovar Square root of the covariance matrix.

This method must be invoqued with the square root of the distribution covariance matrix C: 

 C^0.5 = ZD

where Z is the matrix of the eigen vectors of C, and D is the diagonal matrix that contains the square roots of its eigen values. To compute this matrix, the user should call the QRandSequencer::computeSqRootCovar helper method.

Attention:
The size of arguments inCenter and inSqRootCovar must be compatible with the dimensionality of this sequencer.

Definition at line 184 of file QRandSequencer.cpp.

00185 {
00186     PACC_AssertM(inCenter.size() == mDimensionality, "getGaussianVector() invalid size for the center vector");
00187     PACC_AssertM((inSqRootCovar.getCols() == mDimensionality) && (inSqRootCovar.getRows()==mDimensionality),
00188                  "getGaussianVector() invalid size for the covariance matrix");
00189 
00190     // generate N(0,I) vector
00191     getGaussianVector(outVector);
00192     // apply transform matrix
00193     outVector = inCenter + inSqRootCovar*outVector;
00194 }

void QRandSequencer::getGaussianVector ( PACC::Vector &  outVector,
const PACC::Vector &  inCenter,
const PACC::Vector &  inStDev 
)

Generate a point vector of gaussian distribution N(inCenter,inStdDev*I).

Parameters:
outVector Generated vector point.
inCenter Center of the gaussian distribution.
inStDev Vector of standard deviations for the Gaussian distribution.

The covariance of the generated distribution is a diagonal matrix with the values in inStDev.

Attention:
The size of arguments inCenter and inStdDev must be equal to the dimensionality of this sequencer.

Definition at line 154 of file QRandSequencer.cpp.

00155 {
00156     PACC_AssertM(inCenter.size() == mDimensionality, "getGaussianVector() invalid size for the center vector");
00157     PACC_AssertM(inStDev.size() == mDimensionality, "getGaussianVector() invalid size for the stdev vector");
00158     
00159     // generate N(0,I) vector
00160     getGaussianVector(outVector);
00161     // apply scales
00162     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < outVector.size(); ++i) outVector *= inStDev[i];
00163     // apply translation
00164     outVector += inCenter;
00165 }

Definition at line 125 of file QRandSequencer.cpp.

00126 {
00127     std::vector<unsigned long> lValues, lMaxValues;
00128     generateSequence(lValues, lMaxValues);
00129     PACC_AssertM((lValues.size()%2)==0 && (lMaxValues.size()%2)==0, "getGaussianVector() internal error");
00130     outVector.resize(lValues.size());
00131     // Box-Muller method to get gaussian distributions.
00132     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < lValues.size(); i+=2) {
00133         const double lX1   = double(lValues[i]) / double(lMaxValues[i]);
00134         const double lX2   = double(lValues[i+1]) / double(lMaxValues[i+1]);
00135         const double lR    = std::sqrt(-2.0 * std::log(1.0 - lX1));
00136         const double lPhi  = 2.0 * M_PI * lX2;
00137         outVector[i]   = lR * std::cos(lPhi);
00138         outVector[i+1] = lR * std::sin(lPhi);
00139     }
00140     outVector.resize(mDimensionality);
00141 }

void QRandSequencer::getIntegerSequence ( std::vector< long > &  outSequence,
const std::vector< long > &  inMinValues,
const std::vector< long > &  inMaxValues 
)

Get a new integer low-discrepancy sequence.

Parameters:
outSequence Generated integer sequence.
inMinValues Minimum value for each component value of the sequence.
inMaxValues Maximum value for each component value of the sequence.
Attention:
The size of arguments inMinValues and inMaxValues must be equal to the dimensionality of this sequencer.

Definition at line 219 of file QRandSequencer.cpp.

00220 {
00221     PACC_AssertM(inMinValues.size() == mDimensionality, "getIntegerSequence() invalid min value vector size");
00222     PACC_AssertM(inMaxValues.size() == mDimensionality, "getIntegerSequence() invalid max value vector size");
00223 
00224     std::vector<unsigned long> lValues, lMaxValues;
00225     generateSequence(lValues, lMaxValues);
00226     outSequence.resize(mDimensionality);
00227     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < mDimensionality; ++i) {
00228         PACC_AssertM(inMinValues[i] < inMaxValues[i], "getIntegerSequence() min value must be less than max value");
00229         const unsigned long lMaxMinRange = inMaxValues[i] - inMinValues[i];
00230         if(lMaxMinRange < (LONG_MAX/20000)) {
00231             outSequence[i] = (lValues[i] * lMaxMinRange) / lMaxValues[i];
00232         } else {
00233             outSequence[i] = (long)std::floor(double(lValues[i]) / double(lMaxValues[i]) * double(lMaxMinRange));
00234         }
00235         outSequence[i] += inMinValues[i];
00236     }
00237 }

Generate a point vector of uniform distribution.

inMinValues Minimum value for each components of the point.
inMaxValues Maximum value for each components of the point.
Attention:
The size of arguments inMinValues and inMaxValues must be equal to the dimensionality of this sequencer.

Definition at line 278 of file QRandSequencer.cpp.

00279 {
00280     PACC_AssertM(inMinValues.size() == mDimensionality, "getUniformVector() invalid min value vector size");
00281     PACC_AssertM(inMaxValues.size() == mDimensionality, "getUniformVector() invalid max value vector size");
00282 
00283     std::vector<unsigned long> lValues, lMaxValues;
00284     generateSequence(lValues, lMaxValues);
00285     outVector.resize(mDimensionality);
00286     for(unsigned int i = 0; i < mDimensionality; ++i) {
00287         PACC_AssertM(inMinValues[i] < inMaxValues[i], "getUniformVector() min value must be less than max value");
00288         const double lMaxMinRange = inMaxValues[i] - inMinValues[i];
00289         outVector[i] = lMaxMinRange * (double(lValues[i]) / double(lMaxValues[i]));
00290         outVector[i] += inMinValues[i];
00291     }
00292 }

00355     
00356     // Get prime numbers used as basis.
00357     PACC_AssertM(inDimensionality <= 1000, "reset() dimensionality cannot exceed 1000");
00358     const unsigned int lDim = inDimensionality + (inDimensionality % 2);
00359     mBases.resize(lDim);
00360     for(unsigned int i=0; i < lDim; ++i) mBases[i] = l1000FirstPrimes[i];
00361     std::random_shuffle(mBases.begin(), mBases.end(), inRand);
00362     // Reset counters to 0.
00363     mCounters.resize(lDim);
00364     for(unsigned int i=0; i<lDim; ++i) mCounters[i].clear();
00365     // Set permutations for the different basis.
00366     mPermutations.resize(lDim);
00367     for(unsigned int i=0; i<lDim; ++i) {
00368         mPermutations[i].resize(mBases[i]);
00369         for(unsigned int j=0; j < mPermutations[i].size(); ++j) mPermutations[i][j] = j;
00370         std::random_shuffle(mPermutations[i].begin()+1, mPermutations[i].end(), inRand);
00371     }
00372     // Set dimensionality and counter values.
00373     mDimensionality = inDimensionality;
00374     mCount = 0;
00375 }
